msbt.message: It just looks like a hunk of rock. But it was def doing the "alive" thing a long time ago
At first, I was kind of confused by all these lines. But now I get it! It's totes an evolutionary timeline!
I bet they never imagined that, 300 gajillion years after their last coffee, they'd be getting stared at by us.I don't want to wait that long to have folks come see me. Put me onstage right now!

I've been checking out this evolution tree Did you know all the critters in the world share a common ancestor? You have to trace it back a zajillion years, but you and me and everyone that's ever lived are related!Crazy, right?! Something as fierce as a dinosaur evolved from the same critter as li'l ol' me!
The fossils here are huuuuuuuuge. It must've been rough finding fab clothes to strut around in.
This place is great. It's giving me all kinds of fashion ideas.Like, get this "Mesozoic chic"! Oh! Better idea! "Mezochic"! Right? I love it! Do you love it? I love it!
These are from the Cenozoic era. That means they're from the last 66 million years!That makes them "new" fossils, but still totes old for you and me.
Do you think I'll be on display here someday? As, I mean, a pop-star fossil?Nah I'm going to live forever!
All these fossils are kind of the same color If I'm ever a fossil, I want to be covered in glitter! Sparkly forever!
You came all this way to check out the museum? Do we have some sort of fossil celebs, ?
I love seeing trendy new things, but museums are fab because you can go see what used to be trendy!
These fossils look like they're about to start moving! Does Blathers know they might do that?<10_4 /> Is he prepared?!
How do you like our tr√®s fabuloso new museum, ?There's a bunch of room here for a fossil collection! This is going to be so great, !
I'm here today pretending I'm a celebrity attending the museum's opening gala.AlsoI'm pretending there's an opening gala.

Can you believe it? This used to be a deserted island! Totally nobody here, and now it has its very own museum! Maybe Blathers will do a display showing what the island was like before we built the museum?
